definition: to bury husband and wife together/joint interment
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: In other words, "human and animal burials" will be banned.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，“人畜合葬”將被禁止。

sentences.english: But never again would he be allowed to visit it-until he was buried next to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 可惜的是直到他死後與妻子合葬才又回到泰姬陵。

sentences.english: Actually this is a joint tomb both for Li and his wife.
sentences.chinese: 墓冢爲李鴻章與趙氏夫人的合葬墓。

sentences.english: All my life's bliss is in the grave with thee.
sentences.chinese: 我一生的幸福啊，都已在這裏，與你合葬。

sentences.english: After my death, I will be buried together with you in Shichenxi Cave.
sentences.chinese: 待我死後，就同你合葬在石沉溪洞。

sentences.english: A duel burial and ship coffin remains were also excavated for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 且還首次發掘出合葬墓，首次發現了船棺痕跡等。

sentences.english: "Husband and wife sharing the grave" was a vastly prevailing funeral custom in the Tang society.
sentences.chinese: “夫妻合葬”是唐代社會一種廣爲流行的喪葬習俗。

definition: buried and at rest (idiom); Resquiescat in pacem (RIP)
to bury sth along with the dead/sacrificial grave goods
